titleStmt.title: A great fight in Wales Sixteen colours taken, armes and ammunition, with the prisoners, and men slain. The Parliaments recalling their former [v]otes, for making no further addresses to the King, and the new addresse to be made unto him. The letters on Munday last from Scotland, and a message from the Parliament of England to the Parliament of Scotland, in answer to the demands and proposals. Also the proceedings of Sir Marmaduke Langdale, and the raising of forces in the North. And letters from the Prince, and the duke of York.

A great fight in Wales Sixteen colours taken, armes and ammunition, with the prisoners, and men slain. The Parliaments recalling their former [v]otes, for making no further addresses to the King, and the new addresse to be made unto him. The letters on Munday last from Scotland, and a message from the Parliament of England to the Parliament of Scotland, in answer to the demands and proposals. Also the proceedings of Sir Marmaduke Langdale, and the raising of forces in the North. And letters from the Prince, and the duke of York.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
